comments.body:
The `slow` and `skipif` markers are copied from the actual tests further down below.

While not strictly necessary, this does mean that the cache is _only_ cleared when one is actually running the typing tests (which I feel is a desirable property).
I fail to see why `pytest` would care, the decorated function is not a test and I don't see why it would ever get executed. Is it called anywhere?

The `autouse=True` argument of `@pytest.fixture` ensures that the function will be automatically executed _before_ running any of the actual tests. This also means it is insensitive towards, for example, test randomization.

Secondly, a bit of trial and error shows that fixtures it does respect the `@pytest.mark` decorators.
